author: Efecto Cocuyo | @efectococuyo
title: Gremio educativo rechaza suspensión de salarios a docentes públicos que trabajan para la Avec
text:
Las distintas organizaciones sindicales signatarias de la II Convención Colectiva Vigente del gremio educativo se pronunciaron este jueves en rechazo a lo que consideran actos de violación a sus derechos laborales, por parte del Ministerio de Educación, entre ellos la suspensión de sueldo de la que fueron objeto docentes de instituciones públicas.
«Rechazamos las constantes violaciones a la Convención Colectiva, las leyes y los acuerdos suscritos entre el patrono y las Federaciones del Magisterio venezolano y sus sindicatos afiliados», indica parte de un comunicado público firmado, entre otros, por la Federación Venezolana de Maestros, Fetraenseñanza, Fenatev, Colegio de Profesores de Venezuela y Fetrasined .
El gremio de la enseñanza afirma no entender cómo, ante la falta demás de 250.000 educadores en las escuelas o planteles, la respuesta y actuación de MinEducación sea la de suspender los pagos de salarios, cesta tickets, bonos, aguinaldos y otros beneficios a maestros, profesores, administrativos y obreros, especialmente aquellos que además de trabajar en el sector público ejercen su profesión en planteles privados, como los afiliados a la Asociación Venezolana de Educación Católica (Avec), como se ha venido denunciando.
«Esto, sin la apertura de un procedimiento de averiguación y determinación de faltas a los fines de la decisión correspondiente conforme la Disposición Transitoria Primera de la Ley Orgánica de Educación, LOPA, LEFP, Reglamento del Ejercicio de la Profesión Docente y contratos colectivos, en abierta violación a la inamovilidad laboral y el fuero sindical, artículos 418 y 419 de la LOTTT. En tal sentido, es lamentable que el Ministerio del Poder Popular para la Educación (MPPE), que debe respetar la Constitución como norma suprema y fundamento del ordenamiento jurídico, actué en clara y absoluta violación al principio de legalidad», agrega el comunicado.
MinEducación dice que matrícula escolar creció en Venezuela, por lo que debe eliminarse horario mosaico Según señalaron los organismos sindicales, el Ministerio de Educación comete “atropellos” contra los trabajadores que tienen dualidad de cargos en instituciones públicas y privadas.
Entre las irregularidades que denuncian se encuentran la suspensión del salario y otros beneficios de los docentes que prestan sus servicios públicos y privados.
“Han dejado sin pago de aguinaldo y quincena sin justificación, lo que argumentan es que están haciendo un cruce, que el Ministerio de Educación está viendo, quienes están dando clases y quiénes no”, aseguró Griselda Sánchez, presidenta de la ONG Formación para la Dirigencia Sindical (Fordisi), en entrevista para Radio Fe y Alegría .
El ministro de Educación, Héctor Rodríguez, se pronunció sobre este tema el 11 de noviembre y aseguró: “El Ministerio de Educación no está solicitando que los docentes que trabajan en escuelas de la Asociación Venezolana de Educación Católica (AVEC) y a la vez en instituciones públicas tengan que renunciar a uno de los dos turnos”.
No obstante, desde distintos estados del país los gremios han recibido las quejas de docentes y otros trabajadores a los que no se les canceló quincenas desde octubre ni sus pagos correspondientes a la Navidad.
Fordisi refuta estas declaraciones y asegura que a los docentes que prestan sus servicios en instituciones educativas públicas adscritas al Ministerio de Educación y planteles educativos afiliados a la AVEC, además de la suspensión injustificada de salarios, les retienen el pago de utilidades, más conocido como aguinaldo, a pesar de que no existe ningún conflicto de horarios ni incumplimiento de sus responsabilidades laborales.

author: WPTV - Staff
title: DeSantis declares state of emergency ahead of potential landfall of Invest 97L
text:
Gov. Ron DeSantis issued an executive order Thursday declaring a state of emergency for parts of Florida ahead of potential landfall of Invest 97L.
The governor declared the following counties under a state of emergency:
Alachua, Baker, Bay, Bradford, Calhoun, Charlotte, Citrus, Clay, Collier, Columbia, Dixie, Duval, Escambia, Flagler, Franklin, Gadsden, Gilchrist, Gulf, Hamilton, Hernando, Hillsborough, Holmes, Jackson, Jefferson, Lafayette, Lake, Lee, Leon, Levy, Liberty, Madison, Manatee, Marion, Monroe, Nassau, Okaloosa, Orange, Osceola, Pasco, Pinellas, Polk, Putnam, Santa Rosa, Sarasota, Seminole, St. Johns, Sumter, Suwannee, Taylor, Union, Volusia, Wakulla, Walton and Washington.
The WPTV First Alert Weather team is monitoring Invest 97L .
The tropical wave is producing a large area of disorganized showers and thunderstorms over Hispaniola and the southeastern Bahamas. The wave is expected to move west-northwestward near or over Cuba on Friday and then over the Straits of Florida Friday night or Saturday, the National Hurricane Center said.
Environmental conditions are expected to be conducive for additional development and a tropical depression is likely to form this weekend over Florida.
Regardless of development, heavy rains could cause areas of flash flooding across Florida through the weekend.
Scripps Only Content 2024

author: Charlie Malam
title: Tottenham boss Ange Postecoglou moans about VAR after Brighton loss | Football | Sport | Express.co.uk
text:
Tottenham were 4-0 down with 15 minutes to go at Brighton (Image: GETTY) Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou was full of praise for his players despite their 4-2 defeat to Brighton on Thursday night and slipped in a dig at VAR Peter Bankes for failing to send off Lewis Dunk in the second half. Spurs found themselves 4-0 down at the Amex Stadium before a valiant late fightback saw them at least avoid a humiliating scoreline.
Related articles
Premier League rule has saved Man Utd boss Erik ten Hag from another cruel blow
Arsenal in new VAR farce as Gunners convinced West Ham goal shouldn't have stood Spurs looked set for embarrassment, and Postecoglou's heaviest defeat at the club, when they trailed by four goals with 15 minutes to go. Jack Hinshelwood, a Joao Pedro brace both from the penalty spot and Pervis Estupinan's long-range stunner had the hosts in total control.
But Alejo Veliz's first goal for the club reduced the arrears with nine minutes of normal time to play. The Spurs away end was all but empty by that stage but Ben Davies then headed in from Pedro Porro's cross to make it 4-2.
Despite a flurry of late chances, with Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg hitting the post, Spurs could not muster another goal to really pile the pressure on Brighton. The defeat ends a three-match winning streak and means the north Londoners have lost five of their last nine league matches after such an electrifying start to the campaign.
Postecoglou stayed positive post-match and said to BBC Match of the Day: "We've asked a lot of these players for a very long time and we lacked a little bit of energy today. They are a good team and we struggled to cope with them. We hung in there and that's all you can ask for, they left everything out there.
DON'T MISS: Man Utd receive ‘£40m approach’ for Greenwood but Jim Ratcliffe has other plans
Lewis Dunk was perhaps fortunate not to be sent off vs Tottenham (Image: AMAZON PRIME) "There are no grumbles from me with the penalties. They were clear and obvious. It's amazing that VAR picks up everything apart from a tackle that maybe puts out another of our players."
Postecoglou was referring to the tackle from Brighton captain Dunk on Dejan Kulusevski in the lead-up to Veliz's goal. Dunk was given a yellow card but arguably should have seen red for landing his studs on the Swede's ankle. Kulusevski was able to continue after a brief scare.
The Tottenham boss added: "There were positives at the end this group of players are giving everything at the moment. It is demanding to play the football we ask and they are doing it week in week out. It's not for a lack of effort. We haven't been able to give the players a break at all and what we ask is pretty taxing."
Postecoglou continued to Amazon Prime: "To be fair on the lads, they've put in a hell of a shift over the last few weeks. We looked a bit leggy and Brighton were good as always. They're a good side. We kind of hung in there till the end and you can't fault the effort.
Read
Get Trending
Tottenham have lost five of their last nine Premier League matches (Image: GETTY) "The team continues to show character. We lacked some energy tonight. Against Brighton that's going to cost you. It was a mountain to climb in the end. From our perspective, the good thing was that the lads gave everything they could in the game.
"It's because we've got 10 players injured. You can go to the well as many times the way we play... like I said, the players gave everything again, that's all I can ask for. It's a credit to them we're in the position we are.
"I thought first half we were a little bit wasteful. Second half we created enough to score some a couple more goals but Brighton scored from a similar amount of chances in the first half. No lessons [to take]. All a new manager can ask for is for his players to give everything they've got."
At the 19-match mark Spurs sit fifth and six points off first-placed Liverpool. Manchester City, in fourth, are just one point in front but have a game in hand on the Lilywhites.
Postecoglou's side welcome Bournemouth to the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium for their final fixture of 2023 on New Year's Eve, though they will be without the suspended Kulusevski against the Cherries. Son Heung-min is expected to play before linking up with South Korea for the Asian Cup in Qatar.
Related articles Luke Littler sends forgotten Man Utd star a message at World Darts Championship Ronaldo already told Jim Ratcliffe the five things he needs to fix at Man United

author: robbybienestar@pulzo-hermes.com
title: Oración para pedir el descanso eterno de un perro o gato enfermo: déjela ir
text: Hoy en día [las mascotas se han convertido en uno de los pilares más importantes](https://www.pulzo.com/vivir-bien/oracion-sanacion-perro-gato-enfermo-sanara-muy-rapido-PP3188042A) de la familia. Pero, cuando una mascota presenta una enfermedad, suele ser una gran preocupación que agobia a los demás, y más, cuando se sabe que no hay una cura. San Francisco de Asís se destacó como un santo dedicado a la protección y sanación de los animales, por lo que muchos recurren a él o a otros santos en busca de intercesión para el pronto descanso de sus queridas mascotas. A continuación, compartimos una oración poderosa que puede recitar en honor a este santo o al de su elección, solicitando su petición. (Lea también: [Oraciones a San Pancracio: el santo del dinero que le ayudará a ganarse la lotería](https://www.pulzo.com/vivir-bien/san-pancracio-oraciones-pedir-dinero-suerte-juegos-azar-PP2996177A)) Oración para pedir por el descanso eterno de su mascota “Dios amado, en este momento de profunda tristeza y preocupación, me acerco a ti con un corazón pesaroso y una súplica sincera. Te pido, Señor, que mires con compasión a nuestra querida mascota que está enferma y sufre. Sabemos que tú eres el [Dios de toda la creación](https://www.pulzo.com/vivir-bien/como-se-le-debe-orar-dios-claves-oraciones-que-escuche-PP3051802A), y que el amor que sientes por todas tus criaturas es infinito. Por eso, hoy te pedimos que extiendas tu mano sanadora sobre esta criatura que tanto amamos. En tus manos, Dios misericordioso, ponemos a [nombre de la mascota]. Sabemos que conoces su sufrimiento y su dolor mejor que nadie. Te pedimos que le concedas alivio y que le permitas descansar en paz. Si es tu voluntad, te pedimos que cierres sus ojos al sufrimiento y le des la paz que tanto necesita. Ayúdanos a aceptar tu plan, incluso si es difícil para nosotros. (Lea también: [Oraciones al Arcángel San Miguel: protéjase contra las fuerzas de la oscuridad y el mal](https://www.pulzo.com/vivir-bien/arcangel-san-miguel-oraciones-pedir-proteccion-salud-bienestar-ayuda-PP2947276A)) También te pedimos fuerza y consuelo para nosotros, sus fieles cuidadores. Estamos llenos de amor y gratitud por el tiempo que hemos compartido con [nombre de la mascota]. Pedimos tu apoyo para atravesar este momento de tristeza y pérdida. Danos la sabiduría para tomar las decisiones correctas en cuanto al cuidado de nuestra mascota y ayúdanos a enfrentar esta situación con amor y compasión. Dios, encomendamos a [nombre de la mascota] a tu cuidado amoroso. Sabemos que tu amor y compasión son infinitos, y confiamos en que harás lo que sea mejor para nuestro ser querido. Gracias por escuchar nuestras súplicas y por estar a nuestro lado en este momento de dificultad. En tu nombre, oramos. Amén.” *Este artículo fue escrito y curado por periodistas del equipo de [Robby Bienestar](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/robby-bienestar), con apoyo de una inteligencia artificial que utiliza machine learning para producir texto. LO ÚLTIMO [Vivir Bien] Hace 56 días [Oración a San Martín de Porres: conocido por su labor con los pobres, enfermos y animales](/vivir-bien/oracion-diaria-san-martin-porres-pedir-su-interseccion-ayuda-PP3202050A) [Vivir Bien] Hace 52 días [Oración para pedir por la seguridad de militares que están prestando servicio](/vivir-bien/oracion-militares-soldados-pedir-seguridad-proteccion-ellos-PP3209720A) [Vivir Bien]

author: PA News Agency
title: Pedro Porro strike earns Tottenham FA Cup victory over Burnley | News and Star
text: Pedro Porro’s 25-yard special helped Tottenham stumble into the FA Cup fourth round with a hard-fought 1-0 home win over Burnley. Spurs were far from vintage and a replay at Turf Moor appeared on the cards until Ange Postecoglou watched full-back Porro make the breakthrough with a superb strike in the 78th minute. It earned Tottenham a deserved fourth win from five matches, but Clarets boss Vincent Kompany could take positives after a solid display and they will now concentrate fully on staying in the Premier League. Spurs had already beaten Burnley 5-2 this season, but they were missing their hat-trick hero from that sunny September day with Son Heung-min away for the Asian Cup and the visitors started brightly in north London. Anass Zaroury blazed over early on before Wilson Odobert tested Tottenham goalkeeper Guglielmo Vicario with a long-range effort. Postecoglou had only made two changes for this third-round tie and arguably his strongest available team soon started to click into gear. Richarlison scuffed wide after a slick move before Brennan Johnson’s curler forced Arijanet Muric into action. The stadium was united in applause soon after when the clock struck 16 minutes as a tribute took place for Tottenham fan Harry Pitman, who was killed on New Year’s Eve. Giovani Lo Celso hooked over at the end of a touching minute’s applause before VAR checked Rodrigo Bentancur’s tackle on Zaroury, but Spurs’ stand-in skipper avoided punishment. Kompany’s side created their best chance with 27 minutes gone when Zaroury’s scooped pass put Zeki Amdouni through on goal but he fired over, and while the offside flag was raised, it would have counted. Johnson did flash wide from a Porro centre before half-time, but a drab first 45 ended goalless in N17. Tottenham were sent out early for the second half and it initially had the desired effect with Dejan Kulusevski driving over, while Lo Celso and Johnson tested Muric. Spurs were still trying to walk the ball in, though, and groans were audible from the home fans when Kulusevski decided to pass instead of shoot from a promising position. Lo Celso limped off moments later and Burnley also lost Charlie Taylor to a shoulder injury, which forced Kompany into a triple substitution with Nathan Redmond amongst those introduced. Johnson had called Muric into action again by this point with a volley into the ground before the hosts had half-hearted penalty appeals waved away when the attacker went down after slight contact by Josh Brownhill. A replay at Turf Moor seemed to loom large as the seconds ticked away, but Porro had other ideas. Moments after Richarlison failed to get on the end of Kulusevski’s cross, Porro won back possession from Ameen Al-Dakhil and let fly from 25 yards, with his dipping effort nestling into the corner. Tottenham substitute Ryan Sessegnon nearly put the game to bed in the 86th minute but Muric saved and Burnley’s goalkeeper almost set up a late leveller from a corner only for Amdouni to volley wide. Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. [Read the rules here](/misc/comments)

author: Matthew Keck
title: Man found shot to death inside car in California neighborhood identified
text: Coroners identify 47-year-old found shot to death inside car in California neighborhood Coroners identify 47-year-old found shot to death inside car in California neighborhood TOMORROW. REPORTING IN THE STUDIO, MADELINE CARTER, WLKY NEWS. LATE BREAKING NEWS RIGHT NOW. POLICE ARE INVESTIGATING A DEADLY SHOOTING IN THE CALIFORNIA NEIGHBORHOOD. IT HAPPENED ABOUT A HALF HOUR AGO IN THE 1500 BLOCK OF PRENTISS STREET. IT’S NEAR THE COMMUNITY CENTER IN THE PARK THERE. METRO SAFE CONFIRMS THERE WAS ONE VICTIM WHO DIED. WE HAVE A CREW HEADED TO THE SCENE, AND WE WILL, OF COURSE, UPDATE Y Advertisement Coroners identify 47-year-old found shot to death inside car in California neighborhood The Jefferson County Coroner's Office has identified the man who was found shot to death inside a car earlier this week.Louisville Metro Police Department responded to the 1500 block of Prentice Street on Tuesday around 5:23 p.m. about a person down in a vehicle.When officers arrived, they found 47-year-old Roderick McKisick suffering from a gunshot wound inside a car. Officers attempted to render life-saving aid, but he was pronounced dead on the scene.LMPD's Homicide Unit is handling the investigation. No arrests have been made at this time.Anyone with information regarding the case is asked to call LMPD's anonymous tip line at 502-574-LMPD (5673) or use the LMPD Crime Tip Portal. LOUISVILLE, Ky. — Anyone with information regarding the case is asked to call LMPD's anonymous tip line at 502-574-LMPD (5673) or use the The Jefferson County Coroner's Office has identified the man who was found shot to death inside a car earlier this week. Louisville Metro Police Department responded to the 1500 block of Prentice Street on Tuesday around 5:23 p.m. about a person down in a vehicle. Advertisement When officers arrived, they found 47-year-old Roderick McKisick suffering from a gunshot wound inside a car. Officers attempted to render life-saving aid, but he was pronounced dead on the scene. LMPD's Homicide Unit is handling the investigation. No arrests have been made at this time. Anyone with information regarding the case is asked to call LMPD's anonymous tip line at 502-574-LMPD (5673) or use the [LMPD Crime Tip Portal](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.p3tips.com/TipForm.aspx?ID=563&C=&T=__;!!Ivohdkk!mW8HotqvizN6kDzZUkg5wjmWrPAP9kIlAC3aCCxD4wRjQWg-hgOvkIi2zZmau1iruxA2quV99cDCbs6_OCe7m3DD1N0e$).

author: Nicholas McEntyre
title: 31 California workers rescued after tunnel collapse traps them 300 feet below LA: officials - NewsBreak
text: Thirty-one construction workers were rescued when an underground industrial tunnel they were working in collapsed in Los Angeles Wednesday night. The workers were inside the tunnel, 300 to 400 feet below the surface, just before 8 p.m., when the collapse occurred, the Los Angeles Fire Department said. A 12 to 15-foot mound of dirt separated some of the workers from the main group in the 18-foot diameter, underground shaft in the Wilmington neighborhood. The trapped workers managed to climb over the tall barrier to regroup with others in the tunnel. Crime, soaring rent to shutter LA’s oldest restaurant — which claims to have invented the French dip sandwich — after 117 years Officials were unsure how large the collapse was and didn’t release the cause of the collapse. The workers took turns taking shuttle carts back to the only entry/access point in the tunnel, five to six miles from the site of the collapse. NBA guard Ty Jerome asks $2.59M for his light-filled LA home amid his move to Memphis Cranes were used to hoist the workers to the surface around 10 p.m. Over 100 first responders were at the scene to meet the freed crew and conduct medical evaluations. There were no signs of “visible injuries,” the LAFD reported. CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP FOR OUR MORNING REPORT NEWSLETTER Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass was at the scene, speaking with several of the rescued workers hours after the collapse. “I just spoke with many of the workers who were trapped. Thank you to all of our brave first responders who acted immediately. You are LA’s true heroes,” she wrote on X. The tunnel is being constructed for municipal waste management, part of the $630.5 million Los Angeles Effluent Outfall Tunnel. The tunnel project was greenlit in April 2019, with construction on the shaft’s opening beginning in 2020. Mining officially began on the main tunnel in January 2022. It is planned to stretch 7 miles from the Carson shaft site to Royal Palms Beach, according to the LA County Sanitation District’s Clearwater Project. The goal of the project is to update the aging infrastructure built in 1937 and 1958, make the sewage system more efficient in the earthquake-prone area and update the capacity that the current tunnels can hold. For top headlines, breaking news and more, visit nypost.com.
topics: Disaster and Accident->industrial accident and incident

author: Le10Sport.com
title: Mercato : Le transfert qui va régaler les supporters de l’OM ! - Le10sport.com
text: Neal Maupay (28 ans) a fait un choix fort à la toute fin du mercato : quitter la Premier League et Everton afin de s’engager en faveur de l’OM. Il fait ainsi le chemin inverse d’Iliman Ndiaye. Affirmant avoir une mentalité similaire à celle des supporters de l’Olympique de Marseille, Maupay pourrait bien devenir un chouchou du public. À seulement 21 ans, Neal Maupay quittait le football français après avoir été lancé dans le grand bain du haut de ses 16 ans à l’OGC Nice, le club où il a fait ses classes. Après le GYM, c’est à l’ASSE pendant une saison que le natif de Versailles a évolué avant d’être prêté au Stade Brestois pour une ultime pige. Après quoi, il fut temps pour Maupay de traverser la manche et de s’installer à Londres. Mercato : L’OM est passé tout proche d’un gros coup de dernière minute— le10sport (@le10sport) [https://t.co/o2I7tUy9Of] [pic.twitter.com/wEjC5G8LLw] [September 5, 2024] «Revenir dans un club comme l'OM est la plus belle porte de retour» Depuis 2017, Neal Maupay a roulé sa bosse dans le football anglais, d’abord à Brentford puis à Brighton et enfin à Everton. Chez les Toffees, Maupay n’est jamais parvenu à pleinement s’imposer et a été prêté avec option d’achat obligatoire à l’OM cet été. Le coût global de l’opération grimpera à 6M€ en fin de saison prochaine. À Marseille, Neal Maupay revit déjà avant même d’avoir foulé la pelouse du Vélodrome. « Je suis assez excité car ça fait longtemps que j'ai quitté le championnat de France et revenir dans un club comme l'OM est la plus belle porte de retour ». «Ma mentalité colle avec celle des supporters et du club» En interview pour les médias de l’OM qui a été rapportée par La Provence, Neal Maupay a fait, au passage, une promesse aux fervents supporters de l’ [Olympique de Marseille](https://le10sport.com/football/mercato/mercato-om-un-joueur-fait-ses-adieux-711974) qui risque de trouver son public. « J'ai évolué, j'étais un enfant lorsque je suis parti, je reviens en tant qu'adulte. J'ai plus confiance en mes qualités, mon jeu et je sais ce que je peux apporter à mon équipe. Je donne tout pour le maillot que je porte et ma mentalité colle avec celle des supporters et du club ».

author: Dexter Tilo
title: Half of retail workers using AI at work: UKG report
text: Can technology help employees avoid burnout at work? One in two retail workers across Australia has revealed that they are using artificial intelligence or automation in the workplace, according to a new report from UKG. The report, which polled 252 Australian respondents, found that 50% are using AI or automation at work. That’s ahead of New Zealand's 33% but behind Singapore's 92%. Automation is the biggest benefit from AI cited by Australian retail workers, as it improves inventory management (64%), scheduling (57%), as well as time, attendance, leave, and accruals (56%). Source: UKG Workforce Institute 2024 Industry Insights Report In the wake of these benefits from AI, 57% of Australians said they would like to use the technology if it meant improving day-to-day work . In fact, the respondents said they look forward to using AI for staff management processes, inventory management, scheduling, as well as customer sentiment analysis. Source: UKG Workforce Institute 2024 Industry Insights Report Using tech to ease challenges The widespread use and strong desire to use AI among the Australian workforce comes as a quarter of respondents admitted to somewhat feeling burnt out in their current role. Among the reasons they cited for burnout include: Being understaffed (77%)- Wanting a higher salary (63%) - Poor management (49%) UKG said that technology plays a "critical role" in avoiding burnout in the workplace. Citing the case of City Beach, UKG said the company ensured employees were not overwhelmed by implementing a system that helped streamline task assignments, enhanced communication, and offered real-time visibility into workloads. "Mitigating burnout and effectively managing fatigue are vital in ensuring your workforce remains energetic and efficient," the report reads. "By understanding how your employees are feeling and if they are feeling supported by management, you can assess and provide the right tools and processes to alleviate fatigue."
